title: SB 1.19.9-10 Part 6 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 14-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमाओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामेन्नति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पाश्चत्यदेशतारिने

Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Jai Vanarottamam Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 9th and 10th verses of the 19th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
This is a continuation of the discussion of the same two verses which we have done in the past five sessions.
We completed part 5 of the discussion of these two verses because it is a long purport.
So, this session will be the part 6 of these two verses which we will be discussing.
These two verses are listing the great sages who arrived from different parts of the universe to witness the great emperor Mahabhagavata.
Pure devotee Parikshit Maharaj put his body in perfect Krishna consciousness.
So, this quitting the body which means when death comes we have to leave the body.
We means each one of us is spirit, spirit soul.
So, we have to leave the body and we have to leave this body.
So, one in knowledge is able to face death perfectly by understanding that time has come to leave this body and move on.
So, in that sense.

everything belongs to Krishna, but on behalf of Krishna

They take responsibility of carrying out their duties of guiding the people how to live in this world, how to maintain oneself with the minimum needs of the body, at the same time cultivate Krishna consciousness and prepare oneself to ultimately go back to Godhead.

So, Parashurama is instructing us by performing the severe penances and after he has become free from all reactions by the atonement through the recommended method of this chastra, he gave away the earth planet because he had conquered.
He is the rightful.
He is the rightful owner.
But he gave it away to Kashyapa Muni.
Next, it is said Parashurama instructed the Dhanurveda or the science of fighting to Dronacharya because Dronacharya happened to be a Brahmana.
Parashurama was a Brahmana, he was a teacher.
Because he was expert in military science, he taught that military science to Dronacharya.
And Dronacharya is described in the Mahabharata as,
Parshurama said to Dronacharya,
teacher of military science for the Pandavas and Kauravas. So, we'll discuss more in the next session. I'll stop here. Thank you very much.
